metadata.description: Neurology consultation for new onset seizure

history_of_present_illness.presentation: presented to emergency department after witnessed generalized tonic-clonic seizure
history_of_present_illness.precipitating_factors: sleep deprivation - averaging 4 hours of sleep nightly for the past week due to work stress

social_history.sleep: averaging 4 hours nightly for past week

seizure_precautions: No driving for 6 months per state law
return_precautions: Return to ED if recurrent seizure

history_of_present_illness.expected_content: 28-year-old female with no prior seizure history who presented to the emergency department after witnessed generalized tonic-clonic seizure lasting approximately 2 minutes with post-ictal confusion for 15 minutes. No tongue bite or incontinence noted. She reports recent sleep deprivation due to work stress, averaging 4 hours of sleep nightly for the past week. She denies alcohol or recreational drug use. No head trauma.

neurological_exam.expected_content: Alert and oriented. Cranial nerves intact. Motor strength 5/5 throughout. Sensation intact. Reflexes 2+ symmetric. Negative Romberg. Gait steady.

diagnostic_studies.expected_content:
MRI brain without contrast: No acute abnormality
EEG: Pending
Labs (CMP, CBC, toxicology screen): Unremarkable

assessment.expected_content: New onset seizure, likely provoked by sleep deprivation

plan.expected_content:
1. EEG to evaluate for epileptiform activity
2. Counsel on seizure precautions including no driving for 6 months per state law
3. Avoid sleep deprivation and excessive alcohol
4. Levetiracetam 500 mg twice daily started as prophylaxis given presentation severity
5. Follow up in clinic in 2 weeks with EEG results
6. Return to ED if recurrent seizure
